item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Wendell Berry
item.description: "You can best serve civilization by being against what usually passes for it." -- Wendell Berry

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "What I say is that, if a man really likes potatoes, he must be a pretty decent sort of fellow." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "There are people in the world so hungry, that God cannot appear to them except in the form of bread." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "You can't just eat good food. You've got to talk about it too. And you've got to talk about it to somebody who understands that kind of food." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Julia Child
item.description: "The only real stumbling block is fear of failure. In cooking you've got to have a what-the-hell attitude." -- Julia Child

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Laurie Colwin
item.description: "No one who cooks, cooks alone. Even at her most solitary, a cook in the kitchen is surrounded by generations of cooks past, the advice and menus of cooks present, the wisdom of cookbook writers." -- Laurie Colwin

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by M.F.K. Fisher
item.description: "Sharing food with another human being is an intimate act that should not be indulged in lightly." -- M.F.K. Fisher

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Julia Child
item.description: "How can a nation be called great if its bread tastes like kleenex?" -- Julia Child

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Wendell Berry
item.description: "So, friends, every day do something that won't compute...Give your approval to all you cannot understand...Ask the questions that have no answers. Put your faith in two inches of humus that will build under the trees every thousand years...Laugh. Be joyful though you have considered all the facts....Practice resurrection." -- Wendell Berry

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Wendell Berry
item.description: "We are going to have to gather up the fragments of knowledge and responsibilities that have been turned over to governments, corporations, and specialists, and put those fragments back together again in our own minds and in our families and household and neighborhoods." -- Wendell Berry
